result.execSummary:
The defendant Brice Anthony Schambow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $300.00 + costs = $831.00 - $150.00 Cash Bond = $681.00.The Court grants the Defendant a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office, at a rate of $75.00 a month, starting on or around 07/01/2022 and on the first of every monthly thereafter. Non-payment shall result in a 16 day jail term, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence in being.
The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brice Anthony Schambow

records.addlTxt: Final Notice
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission
with Elements/JIs and Criminal Case Settlement attached

[ml] Case called at 10:08AM
Defendant Brice Anthony Schambow in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled for a Status Conference, however the Defense files resolution paperwork prior to the case being called.
The Court proceeds with Plea and Sentencing:

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $300.00 + costs = $831.00 - $150.00 Cash Bond = $681.00.The Court grants the Defendant a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office, at a rate of $75.00 a month, starting on or around 07/01/2022 and on the first of every monthly thereafter. Non-payment shall result in a 16 day jail term, with Huber privileges, consecutive to any other sentence in being.

The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

Days credit for time already served: 3 days

recess 10:30AM
Scheduling Order
Status conference on June 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Conditions of this Bond include:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Victim 1
--maintain absolute sobriety (no possession or consumption of alcohol, no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription, take all prescription medications only as prescribed)

[ml] Case called at 1:18PM
Defendant Brice Anthony Schambow in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.

The Court requires a $150.00 Cash Bond (already posted) with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Victim 1
--maintain absolute sobriety (no possession or consumption of alcohol, no possession or consumption of alcohol, take all prescription medications only as prescribed)

recess 1:22PM

Initial appearance on March 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
